speakers.name: Andrzej Śliwa
speakers.bio: Software polyglot ninja. Engineering team sensei. Black belt in problem solving. Coding since when software was stored on 5'25 floppies. He likes teaching and sharing his knowledge. He is Open Software Enthusiast.

speakers.name: Nick Sutterer
speakers.bio: Whenever Open-Source meets deep and profound debates about architecting software, and there's free beers involved, Nick Sutterer must be just around the corner. Say Hi to him, he loves people.

speakers.name: Armin Pašalić
speakers.bio: Software builder, mostly Ruby and a bit of Go. Passionate about "proper" testing, clean architecture and DDD. Currently busy constructing a distributed software system with the best colleagues ever at solarisBank AG.

speakers.name: Michał Młoźniak
speakers.bio: Michał is a software engineer, working with Ruby since 2007. He prefers learning more about existing technologies than constantly popping languages and frameworks. When not engaged in a programming gig, you can find him exploring hidden gems of 本州 island.

speakers.name: Nickolay Viuginov
speakers.bio: Currently doing my master’s in machine learning at ITMO University. Maintainer of Ruby Debugger at JetBrains. In my free time, I'm investigating the RubyVM and Delve. I'm also a fan of functional programming.

speakers.name: Vladimir Dementyev
speakers.bio: A mathematician found his happiness in programming Ruby and Erlang, contributing to open source, mentoring Rails devs and being an Evil Martian. Author of AnyCable.

speakers.name: Stefan Wintermeyer
speakers.bio: by apress. Trainer and Consultant for Rails, Phoenix and WebPerformance.

speakers.name: Damir Zekić
speakers.bio: Software engineer who enjoys mentoring and teaching others to program. Has seen the best and the worst of Ruby and Rails throughout the last decade, but always looking to expand own and other people's horizons.

venues.name: University of Wrocław, Institute of Computer Science
